option.name: fileSummaryMaps
option.value: {"C:/Unity Projects/Campaign2028":"{\"/Assets/ScriptableObjectAssets/Card/StateCardSo.cs\":\"This file defines a `StateCardSO` class, which is a ScriptableObject that represents a state card in a game. The file also includes a `ToCard()` function that creates a `StateCard` object from the `StateCardSO` object.\\n\\n`StateCardSO`: A ScriptableObject that represents a state card in a game, containing information such as the state name, description, artwork, electoral votes, success rolls, and flags for roll again and secession.\\n\\n`ToCard()`: A function that creates a `StateCard` object from the `StateCardSO` object, copying the relevant properties.\",\"/Assets/Scripts/Core/Player.cs\":\"This file defines a `Player` class that represents a player in a game. The class has various properties and methods related to the player\\u0027s state, actions, and victory conditions.\\n\\n`Player`: Represents a player in the game, with properties such as name, ID, assigned actor, allegiance, and various tracking variables for victory conditions, events, and battle stats.\\n\\n`CaptureState`: Adds a captured state to the player\\u0027s list of captured states, updates the total electoral votes, and checks for victory conditions.\\n\\n`CaptureInstitution`: Adds a captured institution to the player\\u0027s list of captured institutions and checks for victory conditions.\\n\\n`RemoveState`: Removes a state from the player\\u0027s list of captured states and updates the total electoral votes.\\n\\n`HoldEvent`: Allows the player to hold or discard an event card.\\n\\n`UseHeldEvent`: Allows the player to use the event card they are currently holding.\\n\\n`CheckVictoryConditions`: Checks if the player has met the victory conditions, either by reaching 290 electoral votes or by controlling 4 institutions including the CIA.\\n\\n`RollInitiative`: Rolls an initiative value for the player, which is used in battle.\\n\\n`Attack`: Allows the player to attack another player, using the assigned actor\\u0027s stats to determine the outcome.\\n\\n`GetTeam`: Returns the team (Red or Blue) of the player\\u0027s assigned actor.\",\"/Assets/ScriptableObjectAssets/Card/EventCardSO.cs\":\"This file defines a `ScriptableObject` class called `EventCardSO` that represents an event card in a game. The file also includes a `ToCard()` function that creates an `EventCard` object from the `EventCardSO` data.\\n\\n`EventCardSO`: A `ScriptableObject` class that represents an event card in a game, with properties such as the event name, description, artwork, event type, and whether the card must be played immediately or can be saved.\\n\\n`ToCard()`: A function that creates an `EventCard` object from the `EventCardSO` data.\",\"/Assets/ScriptableObjectAssets/Card/InstitutionCardSO.cs\":\"This file defines a `ScriptableObject` class called `InstitutionCardSO` that represents an institution card in a game. The file also includes a `ToCard()` function that creates an `InstitutionCard` object from the `InstitutionCardSO` object.\\n\\n`InstitutionCardSO`: A `ScriptableObject` class that represents an institution card in a game, containing information such as the institution name, description, artwork, institution type, and success rolls.\\n\\n`ToCard()`: A function that creates an `InstitutionCard` object from the `InstitutionCardSO` object, copying the relevant data.\",\"/Assets/Scripts/Core/Card/Card.cs\":\"This file defines a base `Card` class that serves as the foundation for other card-related classes in a Unity game or application. The `Card` class has three member variables: `cardName`, `description`, and `artwork`.\\n\\n`Card`: An abstract base class that represents a generic card with a name, description, and artwork.\",\"/Packages/packages-lock.json\":\"This file appears to be a Unity package manifest, which lists the dependencies and versions of various Unity packages used in a project. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather a list of package dependencies and their versions. The file serves to manage the project\\u0027s package dependencies and ensure that the required packages are installed and up-to-date.\",\"/Assets/Scripts/Core/Card/ActorCard.cs\":\"This file defines the following classes and enumerations:\\n\\n`ActorCard`: A class that represents an actor card, which contains information about an actor\\u0027s team, type, and various statistics.\\n\\n`ActorTeam`: An enumeration that represents the team an actor belongs to, either \\\"Red\\\" or \\\"Blue\\\".\\n\\n`ActorType`: An enumeration that represents the type of an actor, such as \\\"SouthernRural\\\", \\\"TechOligarch\\\", \\\"TradWife\\\", \\\"ANTIFA\\\", \\\"SocialJusticeKaren\\\", or \\\"PodcastPundit\\\".\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions. It appears to be part of a larger system that deals with actor cards and their associated data.\",\"/Assets/Scripts/Core/Card/AllegianceCard.cs\":\"This file defines a `Card` class and an `AllegianceType` enum.\\n\\n`AllegianceCard`: A class that represents a card with an allegiance type.\\n\\n`AllegianceType`: An enum that defines the possible allegiance types (USA Democrats, USA Republicans, China).\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions, but it sets up the necessary classes and enums for a game or application that involves cards with different allegiance types.\",\"/Assets/Scripts/Core/Card/InstitutionCard.cs\":\"`InstitutionCard`: A class that represents an institution card, which contains information about the institution type, red success rolls, and blue success rolls.\\n\\n`IsSuccessfulRoll`: A function that checks if a given roll is a successful roll for the specified actor team based on the success rolls stored in the `InstitutionCard` instance.\\n\\n`InstitutionType`: An enumeration that defines the different types of institutions, such as Supreme Court, Congress, Media, White House, Pentagon, and CIA.\\n\\nThis file defines a class `InstitutionCard` that represents an institution card in a game or application. The `InstitutionCard` class contains information about the institution type, as well as lists of successful rolls for the red and blue teams. The `IsSuccessfulRoll` function is used to check if a given roll is a successful roll for a specific actor team based on the success rolls stored in the `InstitutionCard` instance. The `InstitutionType` enumeration defines the different types of institutions that can be represented by an `InstitutionCard`.\",\"/Assets/Scripts/Core/GameManager.cs\":\"This file contains the `GameManager` class and several functions that manage the game logic for a game called \\\"Campaign 2028\\\".\\n\\n`GameManager`: Manages the overall game state, including the decks of cards, players, and the current game phase.\\n\\n`InitializeGame()`: Initializes the game by shuffling and separating the decks, and starting the setup phase.\\n\\n`SetupPhase()`: Handles the setup phase of the game, including assigning actors and allegiances to players, and determining the starting player.\\n\\n`AssignActors()`: Assigns actors to players in a random order.\\n\\n`StartTurn()`: Starts a new turn for the current player, including drawing a state/institution card and an event card.\\n\\n`DrawStateOrInstitution()`: Draws a state or institution card from the combined deck and places it on the table.\\n\\n`DrawEvent()`: Draws an event card from the event deck and handles whether it must be played immediately or can be held by the player.\\n\\n`RollDie()`: Handles the player\\u0027s roll of the die and the resulting capture or secession of a state or institution.\\n\\n`HandleSecession()`: Handles the secession of a state, including updating the game state and triggering a civil war if necessary.\\n\\n`CheckCivilWarTrigger()`: Checks if the conditions for triggering a civil war have been met.\\n\\n`StartCivilWar()`: Starts the civil war phase of the game.\\n\\n`CivilWarPhase()`: Handles the civil war phase, including rolling initiative, determining the turn order, and resolving attacks between players.\\n\\n`ApplyEvent()`: Applies the effects of an event card.\\n\\n`EndTurn()`: Ends the current player\\u0027s turn and moves to the next player.\\n\\n`ShuffleDeck()`: Shuffles the cards in a given deck.\",\"/Assets/Scripts/Core/Card/StateCard.cs\":\"`StateCard`: A class that represents a state card in a game, containing information about the state\\u0027s electoral votes, successful rolls for red and blue teams, and whether the state has the ability to roll again or secede.\\n\\n`IsSuccessfulRoll`: A function that checks if a given roll is considered a successful roll for the specified team based on the state card\\u0027s success roll lists.\\n\\nThis file defines a `StateCard` class that represents a state card in a game. The class contains information about the state\\u0027s electoral votes, successful rolls for red and blue teams, and whether the state has the ability to roll again or secede. The `IsSuccessfulRoll` function is used to check if a given roll is considered a successful roll for the specified team based on the state card\\u0027s success roll lists.\",\"/Assets/ScriptableObjectAssets/Card/AllegianceCardSO.cs\":\"This file defines a `ScriptableObject` class called `AllegianceCardSO` that represents an allegiance card in a game or application.\\n\\n`AllegianceCardSO`: A `ScriptableObject` class that represents an allegiance card with a name, description, artwork, and allegiance type.\\n\\n`ToCard()`: A function that creates a new `AllegianceCard` object from the data stored in the `AllegianceCardSO` object.\\n\\nThe file also includes a `CreateAssetMenu` attribute that allows the `AllegianceCardSO` class to be created as an asset in the Unity editor.\",\"/Assets/Scripts/Core/Card/EventCard.cs\":\"This file defines a `EventCard` class and an `EventType` enum. The file does not contain any functions.\\n\\n`EventCard`: A class that represents an event card in a game, with properties for the event type, whether it must be played immediately, and whether it can be saved.\\n\\n`EventType`: An enum that defines the different types of events that can occur in the game, such as extra rolls, needing two cards, challenges, and Chinese agents.\",\"/Packages/manifest.json\":\"This file appears to be a Unity package manifest file, which defines the dependencies for a Unity project. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather lists the various Unity packages and modules that the project depends on. The file specifies the versions of these packages and modules, which are required for the project to function correctly.\",\"/README.md\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It appears to be a heading for a document titled \\\"Campaign2028\\\". The file likely serves as a placeholder or a section header for a larger document or project related to a campaign in the year 2028.\",\"/Assets/ScriptableObjectAssets/Card/GameDeckSO.cs\":\"This file defines a single class:\\n\\n`GameDeckSO`: A ScriptableObject that represents a game deck, which can be created and managed in the Unity editor.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions. It simply defines a new ScriptableObject type called `GameDeckSO` that can be used to create and manage game decks in a Unity project.\",\"/Assets/ScriptableObjectAssets/Card/ActorCardSO.cs\":\"This file defines a `ScriptableObject` class called `ActorCardSO` that represents an actor card in a game. The file also includes a `ToCard()` function that creates an `ActorCard` object from the `ActorCardSO` data.\\n\\n`ActorCardSO`: A `ScriptableObject` class that represents an actor card in a game, containing information such as the actor\\u0027s name, description, artwork, team, type, and various battle stats.\\n\\n`ToCard()`: A function that creates an `ActorCard` object from the `ActorCardSO` data, setting the appropriate values for the card\\u0027s properties.\"}"}
